intro: Rhus galpinii, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes plants such as poison ivy and cashew. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a red, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Rhus galpinii is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
